import React from 'react' import { Stack } from '@mui/system' import Box from '@mui/material/Box'; import Paper from '@mui/material/Paper'; import { styled } from '@mui/material/styles'; import Divider from '@mui/material/Divider'; import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'; import { Button } from '@mui/material'; import FeasibilityItem from './FeasibilityItem' import Grid from '@mui/material/Grid'; import Link from '@mui/material/Link'; import './Home.css' let problems = [ { name: 'High Schools', date: '', description: '', link: '', img: 9, }, { name: 'Community Colleges', date: '', description: '', link: '', img: 6, }, { name: 'Universities', date: '', description: '', link: '', img: 7, }, { name: 'Online Resources', date: '', description: '', link: '', img: 8, }, ] const Item = styled(Paper)(({ theme }) => ({ backgroundColor: theme.palette.mode === 'dark' ? '#1A2027' : '#fff', ...theme.typography.body2, padding: theme.spacing(1), textAlign: 'center', color: theme.palette.text.secondary, })); const Home = () => { return (
Sage advice for your new Career in Tech.
The Problem: Virginians need better jobs. } spacing={2} justifyContent="space-evenly" >From 1973-2022, wages have grown by an average of just $0.18 From 1973-2022, inflation has made $1 from 1970 worth $6.67 in 2022, a growth of $5.67 Virginians require $42,000 per year to stay afloat (2020 data) Computer Jobs Pay Well

They're Plentiful } spacing={2} justifyContent="space-evenly" > By 2030, global shortage of more than 85 million tech workers - $8.5 trillion in lost annual revenue Between 2022 and 2030, the need for software devs expected to increase by 22% (BLS) In 2019, U.S. companies had about 918,000 unfilled IT jobs Even with 60,300 CS graduates, 20,000 bootcamp graduates, and 85,000 H-1B visas, there is still a major gap in needed talent. They're Local The Need Is Immediate

The Benefits to VA are immense

} spacing={2} justifyContent="space-evenly" > VA has strong foundation- highest concentration of tech talent and 3rd largest tech workforce in nation Amazon invested $2.5 billion for VA HQ, requiring 25,000 high tech jobs over next 12 years Virginia is investing more than $2 billion to expand its tech talent pipeline, doubling the number of graduates each year in computer science and closely related fields. Virginia has promised 32,000 additional graduates in CS and related fields over the next 20 years-- how will it get there? College is a Tough Sell Now } spacing={2} justifyContent="space-evenly" >Average Student Loan Balance: $37,113 College is now high-risk: One accredited school costs $155k and offers a negative return over 30 years of $228,000. In a 2022 survey, fully half of respondents say college is a "questionable investment" due to student loans and limited job opportunities.

Virginia's Pipeline has Issues (click on each to view more details) } spacing={2} justifyContent="space-evenly" > {problems.map((diagram) => { return ( ) })}
How Can We Fix It? A tool for Community Colleges and 4-Year Schools in Virginia
) } export default Home
